page.title: 01YOXALL VILLAGE
page.content: The centre of our area of study is the village of Yoxall. The name having been derived from Llaceshall. Facing the wooded height of Cannock Chase across the Vale of Trent,it lies on the diminutive River Swarbourn near its junction with the Trent. A large village,it sits astride the main road from Lichfield to Ashbourne,busy with visitors to the Peak District on Summer week-ends.{See acknowledgements {below.}The main building material is locally made bricks. Isolated timbered buildings survive eg _ Thimble Hall and a cottage opposite Moat House. The main street twists and turns gently uphill giving many changing vistas. At an acute dog leg turning is the centre of the village with ancient cottages, Parish Church and pub. Narrow streets and lanes lead off into open country. {Extracts,Staffs today magazine May 85}
